|Title=Knowing the dental eruption calendar
|Description=None
|Rubric=Physiopathology
|Contributors=
|Order=19}}
Children's teeth

* central incisor around 6 months
* 2nd molar around 2 years

Adult teeth

* Central incisor and first molar around 6 years of age
* First pre-molar around 10-11 years of age
* Canine around 11-12 years
* 3rd molar around 18 years

question.title: What is the typical age range for the eruption of the first permanent molar in children?
question.description: Select the correct age range from the options provided.

option_a.title: 6-7 years
option_a.description: The first permanent molar erupts around 6-7 years of age.

option_b.title: 8-9 years
option_b.description: The first permanent molar erupts around 8-9 years of age.

option_c.title: 10-11 years
option_c.description: The first permanent molar erupts around 10-11 years of age.

option_d.title: 12-13 years
option_d.description: The first permanent molar erupts around 12-13 years of age.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the answer option.
